intro: Pentacalia jalcana, commonly known as the Mexican star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces showy white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
